Package org.cesecore.keys.token.p11

Interface P11SlotUser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AddSubjectToRoleCommand, CaCertRequestCommand, CaCertResponseCommand, CertificateRequestCommand, CheckRevokeStatusCommand, CreateCACommand, CreateCRLCommand, CreateCryptoTokenCommand, CustomLogCommand, CvcGetChainCommand, CvcPemCommand, CvcPrintCommand, CvcRequestCommand, EditUserCommand, EJBCAWSRABaseCommand, FindCertsCommand, FindUserCommand, GenerateCryptoTokenKeysCommand, GenerateNewUserCommand, GetExpiredCertificatesByIssuerCommand, GetExpiredCertificatesByTypeCommand, GetExpiredCertificatesCommand, GetProfileCommand, GetPublisherQueueLength, ImportCaCertCommand, KeyRecoverCommand, KeyRecoverEnrollCommand, PKCS10ReqCommand, PKCS11CryptoToken, PKCS12ReqCommand, RemoveSubjectFromRoleCommand, RevokeCertCommand, RevokeCertWithMetadataCommand, RevokeTokenCommand, RevokeUserCommand, StressTestCommand, UpdateCaCertCommand
    public interface P11SlotUser
    All users of the P11Slot slot must implement this interface. The user may decide whether deactivation is allowed or not. Deactivation of a user is done when the P11Slot object wants to reset P11 session (disconnect and reconnect).

    If deactivation is allowed and deactivate() called the user should:
    Deactivate itself (answer false to isActive()) and call P11Slot.logoutFromSlotIfNoTokensActive() Then P11Slot.getProvider() must be called before using the provider again.

    If deactivation is not allowed then the user may just continue to answer true to isActive().

    Version:
    $Id: P11SlotUser.java 17625 2013-09-20 07:12:06Z netmackan $

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void deactivate()
      Called by the P11Slot when resetting the slot.
      boolean isActive()
      The user should return true if not accepting a slot reset.

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        The user should return true if not accepting a slot reset.
        Returns:
